result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathilda R Caron

defendant.name: Caron, Mathilda R
defendant.address: P.O. Box 583, N5038 Circle Drive, Watersmeet, MI 49969

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mathilda R Caron in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Mathilda R Caron in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:43 PM.  Called 18CF30, 16CM133, 17CM08 and 17CF147. State - here for a change of plea in all matters -  on 16CM133 - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response or VIS - moves to dismiss that case in its entirety and 17CM08 in its entirety. State - on 17CF147 - plead G to counts #1, #4 and #7 as alleged with remaining counts to be DRI - count #1 - impose 365 days in FC Jail - stayed; count #4 - impose 365 days in FC jail - consecutive to count #1 - stayed, place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other, with conditions as follows: costs on each count, on count #7 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges; on 18CF30 - plead G to counts #1, #4 and #7 as alleged, remaining counts to be DRI, on #1 - impose 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES (not eligible for any programs until after 2 years of the sentence is served) - stayed; count #4 -  impose 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - stayed, count #8 - impose 8 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES - stayed, DEJ for 36 months; conditions of all probations is as follows: comply with all terms and conditions of Wellness Cout, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, obtain/maintainfull time employment/school as allowed by the Wellness Court/Probation, 200 hours of community service when deemed appropriate to start by Wellness Cout/Probation, take all meds as prescribed by medical care provider or treating physician, no contact with Tanya Cooper (9/14/83), Cherish Douyette (1/2/86), David Brown (8/31/85), Tara Jean Olds (12/20/90), Vanessa Lynn Pauliot (6/3/91) and Kristen McGeshick (1/13/89), costs of $1100.00 for Forest County Drug Task Force - all of these counts are under a 36 month Deferred Entry of Judgment and if succsessfully completed - those counts would be dismissed. Caron and Lynch agree, would like to address jail credit if revoked. Court makes sure the defendant understands what it means for a count to be DRI. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2, #3, #5, #6, #8, #9, #10, #11 and #12 on 17CF147, 18CF30 - #2, #3, #5, #6, #8, #9, #10, #11, #12 and #13 are to be DRI, 17CM08 - all counts to be DRI. Caron pleads G to all other counts as stated by DA. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty on counts #1, #4 and #7 on 17CF147 and withholds finding of guilt on counts #1, #4 and #7 on 18CF30 as it is a Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement for 3 years. Lynch - credit as follows: on 18CF30 - 91 days credit, 17CF147 - 112 days credit, 17CM08 - 112 days credit and 16CM1363 - 121 days credit - all if revoked. State - follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Caron makes statement, remorseful. Lynch makes statement in regards to expungement upon successful completion of probation and Wellness Court. State agrees. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 17CM147 - count #7 - $300.00 fine plus costs - 60 DTP/CO, counts #1 and #4 - impose 365 days in FC jail - consecutive to each other - stayed, place on probation for 3 years - concurrent to each other - with conditions of: participate and successfuly complete the FC Wellness Court Program, AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol, maintain/obtain full time employment/school as controlled by Wellness Court Program, 200 hours of community service, take all medications in the manner in which they are prescribed, no contact with the individuals identified previously by State, costs on all counts - 60 DTP/CO - credit for 121 days only if revoked, accepts DEJ on 18CF30 for 3 years, felony rights given, submit DNA sample, authorizes expungement under  973.015 for all counts upon succesful completion of probation and DEJ and Wellness Court, drug buy reimbrusement of $1100.00 will be collected by DA Office as it is part of the DEJ,  dismiss and read in case #16CM133, no decision on credit for 18CF30 as it is under a DEJ, right to appeal, adjourned.
Status conference on July 18, 2018 at 01:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Mathilda R Caron in court with attorney Mary Burns whom is appearing specially today for Attorney Lynch. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:05 PM. Called cases 17CF147, 16CM133, 17CM08, 18CF30. State updates court on status of cases. 18CF30 - Burns indicates the complaint has not been gone through with Caron. Court reads charges and penalties. Caron understands charges, penalties and right to attorney, Lynch is listed on all cases. State asks for $10,000 cash bond for stated reasons. Burns does not argue bond at this time. Court imposes $10,000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. 17CM08 - State asks for $2000 cash bond. Court imposes $2000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. 17CF147 - State asks for $2000 cash. Court imposes $2000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. 16CM133 - State asks for $2000 cash bond. Court imposes $2000 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol. All cases to be scheduled for jury trial and 18CF30 to be set for PH, Lynch was given PH date, clerk will look into that and Attorney Lynch is to contact JA to schedule JT dates for all other cases.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on April 26, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Arrested FOSO

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:17 PM. Called 16CM133, 17CF147, 17CM08 and 17TR819. Lynch does not know where his client is. State - informs Court that there is another open case for the defendant that was filed with a warrant. State asks for bench warrant, body or $2000.00 on each case. Court grants and defaults the defendant on 17TR819, 60 DTP/SL.
Final pre-trial on March 7, 2018 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Mathilda R Caron in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:53 AM. Called 16CM133, 17CF147, 17CM08 and 17TR819. State - here for PH on 17CF147 and not sure what the other cases are set for. Court - other matters are set for either AIA or INIT. Lynch is waiving PH. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Lynch will proceed to ARGN, has complaints on all matters, pleads NG to all cases, set all matter for FPT. Court accepts plea on all cases, sets all cases for FPT and 17TR829 will be set as STC, continues bond on all matters.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 28, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Initial appearance on December 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:38 PM. Called 16CM133, 17CF147 and 17CM08. State was advised off the record that the defendant has been taken to the hospital and has now released witnesses due to that information, not aware of what is health issue is with the defendant. Lynch agrees, has spoken with his client, was not aware of any health issues. Court continues bond on all cases, sets for PH on 17CF147 at 8:30 AM and and other two matters as INIT.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on December 6, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Mathilda R Caron in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Mathilda R Caron in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:01 PM. State has faxed a copy of the complaint to FOSO for the defendant and Lynch was handed the complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties. Caron and Lynch understand charges and penalties, waives further reading of it, requests PH, would like to address bond. State - informs Court that the defendant has been on the run and has had bench warrants in two other cases in Forest County (16CM133 and 17CM08), asks for $1000.00 cash on this matter. Lynch - bond - requests lower cash bond of $500.00 for stated reasons. Court - bond - continues $1000.00 cash bond on 17CF147. Court sets for PH. State - asks for $500.00 cash on both 16CM133 and 17CM08, set those two cases for INIT.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 6, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Arrested - FOSO

Defendant Mathilda R Caron in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Mathilda R Caron in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:46 AM. Voorhees has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Voorhees and Caron understand charges and penalties. Voorhees wants to be heard on bond. Voorhees enters NG pleas to all counts and set for FPT. Voorhees - bond - asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to signature bond. Court - bond - $1000.00 signature bond with same conditions.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Kayla VanZile.
Cash set.
